bug.author: felixgalaxy
bug.summary: I ran detect.py, but there was no test result graph
bug.description:
Hello , I have a problem here,can you help me solve it? felix@galaxy:~/myproject/yolov3$ python3 detect.py --cfg cfg/yolov3.cfg --weights weights/yolov3.weights Namespace(cfg='cfg/yolov3.cfg', conf_thres=0.5, data_cfg='data/coco.data', images='data/samples', img_size=416, nms_thres=0.5, weights='weights/yolov3.weights') Using CUDA device0 _CudaDeviceProperties(name='GeForce GTX 1060 6GB', total_memory=6069MB)
image 1/2 data/samples/students.jpeg: 288x416 4 persons, Done. (0.141s) image 2/2 data/samples/zidane.jpg: 256x416 2 persons, 1 ties, Done. (0.028s) but there was no test result graph

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/felixgalaxy>@felixgalaxy</denchmark-link> yes that's correct. Your detected images will be in the folder. Testing is seperate. You can test the accuracy of the network using python3 test.py.
